DataElement.preferredName: Prior Chemotherapy Or Radiosensitizer Agent Administered For Head and Neck Carcinoma Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes No indicator to signify whether patient had prior chemotherapy or radiosensitizers for cancers of the head and neck

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Chemotherapy Or Radiosensitizer Agent Administered For Head and Neck Carcinoma
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to prior radiosensitizer administered._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Drugs used to potentiate the effectiveness of radiation therapy in destroying unwanted cells._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._The reason of something._A carcinoma that arises from the head and neck region.  Representative examples include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Chemotherapy Or Radiosensitizing Agent Agent
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Drugs used to potentiate the effectiveness of radiation therapy in destroying unwanted cells.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An agent that makes tumor cells more sensitive to radiation therapy.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: For Head and Neck Carcinoma Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: The reason of something.:A carcinoma that arises from the head and neck region.  Representative examples include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the head and neck region.  Representative examples include oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma, and salivary gland carcinoma.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior chemotherapy or radiose
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior chemotherapy or radiosensitizers for cancers of the head and neck region; note that prior chemotherapy for a different cancer is allowable, except prior temozolomide. Prior use of Gliadel wafers or any other intratumoral or intracavitary treatment are not permitted.
